text: "Bro Gozh ma ZadoÃ¹" (; , "Old Land of My Fathers") is the anthem of Brittany. It uses the same tune as the Welsh anthem, "Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau", as well as the Cornish anthem, "Bro Goth Agan Tasow". ==Lyrics== ===Breton original=== Breton original IPA transcription ğ„† ğ„‡ ===Translations=== French translation Poetic English translation I Nous, Bretons de cÅ“ur, aimons notre vrai pays! RenommÃ© est l'Armor Ã  travers le monde. Bravement au milieu de la guerre, nos pÃ¨re si bons, VersÃ¨rent pour elle leur sang. Ã” Bretagne, mon pays, j'aime mon pays, Tant que sera la mer comme un rempart autour d'elle, Sois sans chaÃ®nes mon pays ! II Bretagne, terre des vieux saints, terre des bardes, Il n'y a pas d'autre pays au monde que j'aime autant. Chaque mont, chaque vallÃ©e, Ã  mon cÅ“ur est superbe, LÃ  repose plus d'un Breton ardent ! III Les Bretons sont des gens robustes et forts; Il n'y a pas de peuple plus courageux sous les cieux. Complaintes tristes, chansons charmantes germent lÃ , Ã” que tu es beau, mon pays ! IV Si la Bretagne a Ã©tÃ© vaincue dans les grandes guerres, Sa langue est toujours aussi vivante que jamais. Son cÅ“ur ardent bat encore dans sa poitrine, Tu es dÃ©sormais rÃ©veillÃ©e, ma Bretagne ! ğ„† ğ„‡ I We, Bretons by heart, love our true country, Armorica, famous worldwide. Any fear in battle without, our such good fathers, For thee shed their blood. Brittany, my country, I love my country, So long as the sea, like a wall surrounding thee, My country shall be free! II Brittany, land of old Saints, land of bards, There is no other country I love as much. Ev'ry mountain, ev'ry glen to my heart dearest, There rest many heroic Bretons. III The Bretons, a people strong and valiant, No people under the skies are as brave as them, Whether they may sing a sad gwerz or a nice song. O my very beautiful country! IV If in past Brittany may have been in battle defeated, Her language shall always remain well alive. Her flaming heart still in her chest beateth, Thou art now awakened, my dear Brittany! ğ„† ğ„‡ ==References== Category:Brittany Category:French anthems
